What is "Program"?


A program is an abstract state machine.


A behavior of a state machine is a sequence of states.


A state is an assignment of all variables.


A variable is an object in computer memory.

Declarations, Expressions, and Statements (Informal)


double circumference = 0;

circumference = 2 * PI * radius;


Declarations declare variables.

Expressions express values.

Statements state actions.

Expressions (Formal)


circumference = 2 * PI * radius;


  • Variables are expressions;
  • Constants are expressions;
  • If $E_{1}$ and $E_{2}$ are expressions, then $E_{1} \circ E_{2}$ is an expression.
    • ($\circ$ is an operator)

Statements (Formal)


  • Assignment statements
  • If statements
  • For statements
  • $\ldots$

Compound Statements (Blocks)

Declarations and statements surrounded by {}.

Always use {}.
